pageTitle: Coca-Cola Gets DaMarcus Beasley to Promote Soccer - June 16, 2014 - Zacks.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {62788=Copyright © 2015 Zacks Investment Research, 62849=At the center of everything we do is a strong commitment to independent research and sharing its profitable discoveries with investors. This dedication to giving investors a trading advantage led to the creation of our proven Zacks Rank stock-rating system. Since 1986 it has nearly tripled the S&P 500 with an average gain of +26% per year. These returns cover a period from 1986-2011 and were examined and attested by Baker Tilly, an independent accounting firm., 20381=The Coca-Cola Company (KO - Analyst Report) has roped in American soccer superstar DaMarcus Beasley as a part of its FIFA World Cup marketing program. As a part of the partnership, Beasley will invite consumers who buy Coca-Cola drinks to donate a soccer ball to a school of their choice. This “Give a Ball” program includes U.S schools registered with MyCokeRewards.com and encourages the youth to live a healthy and active lifestyle. Through Jul 13, 2014, consumers can also win prizes and download the “The World Is Ours,” Coca-Cola’s song for the 2014 FIFA World Cup™ campaign. Coca-Cola’s other FIFA World Cup marketing programs include its partnership with its bottlers and customer partners like Family Dollar Stores Inc. . The program will provide $15,000 to a local soccer field in need of restoration. Per the contract, Beasley will appear at a congratulatory event following the refurbishment of the soccer field. Moreover, Coca-Cola has partnered with the Boys & Girls Clubs of America to allow two exceptional teens to be the flag bearers for the U.S. team during one of the World Cup matches in Brazil. Each teen will be offered tickets to the United States vs. Germany game in Brazil. Coca Cola has been associated with FIFA since 1974 and has sponsored the World Cup since 1978. The company kicked off its FIFA World Cup marketing program in Apr 2014. The campaign is part of Coca-Cola’s plan to invest $400 million in media in 2014 to reinvigorate its sparkling brands like Coke, Fanta and Sprite that are suffering due to challenges in the carbonated soft drinks (CSD) category. FIFA World Cup 2014 includes big names like Anheuser-Busch InBev SA/NV (BUD - Snapshot Report) and ADIDAS AG (ADDYY - Snapshot Report) as official World Cup sponsors., 14890=by Zacks Equity Research   Published on June 16, 2014 |}
